text: Se ilden lyse (in English: Fire in Your Heart) is a single from Norwegian singer Sissel Kyrkjebø. It is the official song of the 1994 Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway. It was a huge hit in Norway and peaked on number one for three weeks. In English this song is also sung as a duet with Spanish tenor Plácido Domingo.http://articles.philly.com/1994-02-17/sports/25857859_1_figure-nancy- kerrigan-tonya-harding-tommy-moe Both versions are written by Jan Vincents Johannessenhttp://vincentsj.com/music/ and composed by Svein Gundersen. And both versions were also included on the 1994 number-one album release, Innerst i sjelen. ==Background== The duet between Sissel and Plácido Domingo, Fire in Your Heart, was recorded in a canteen in Lillehammer before the opening of the 1994 Winter Olympics. Because of the tight schedules of both Plácido Domingo and Sissel, they had only a few hours to record this English version of the Olympics anthem before the opening ceremony. When they recorded the song in the canteen, coffee cups and food could still be seen on the tables!Soprano Sissel sings for the love of singing The Boston Globe ==Track listing== ==Charts== In Norway Se ilden lyse reached number-one on VG-lista topp 20 and stayed on this list for nine weeks, with three weeks as number one.http://lista.vg.no/artist/sissel-kyrkjeboe/922 The international single- release, Fire in Your Heart peaked on number nine on Sverigetopplistan - Singles top 60 in Sweden and managed to stay on this list for six weeks.http://swedishcharts.com/weekchart.asp?year=1994&date;=19940311&cat;=s The duet-version with Plácido Domingo peaked on number twenty in Switzerland and on number 26 in Germany.Charts.nz ===Se ilden lyse=== ====Weekly charts==== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center" |- !
